review: The one weakness with this product is that it needs a really strong wi-fi signal. My TV is well away from my router and the signal is average at best. A weak signal makes this product unusable. Choppy, constantly buffering and endless hanging while it tries to do its magic has been my experience. I do understand that its my problem not having a decent signal because on the odd occasion when the signal is strong this works really well. I plan to buy the Ethernet adapter that is available for this and put an end to slow flaky wireless connections. If you are not sure about the strength of your signal there is a free android app called Wifi Analyzer that displays signal strength.

review: Extremely difficult to configure.  If you're looking for a streaming device that doesn't require a lot of time to install and use try one of the other devices.  I can't speak for all of the other devices but I have 3 Roku devices all of which we much easier to configure and use. I'm on day 2 with my Chrome device and still trying to get it to work as advertised.  The idea of using your phone, iPad, or tablet as a remote is a neat idea but after this experience I'd opt for a product with its own remote.  However, if you love puzzles buy a Chrome Cast device!
